5.text: This wasp spider waits for some hapless victim

7.text: to fall into its trap: then it will pounce on its prey.

38.text: Spiders set their silken traps in strategic locations,

41.text: tending to and repairing their complicated structures,

44.text: or even building a new one, every day.

59.text: Millions of insects daily fall victim to these invisible,

81.text: detecting the slightest movement of its web through its forelegs.

92.text: When a victim makes contact with the sensitive web,

97.text: the prey is immobilized with a venom that both paralyzes it

101.text: and liquefies its insides with protein-dissolving enzymes.

106.text: Wrapped up in silk, its completely liquefied internal organs

111.text: will be drunk later, at leisure.

132.text: The male of this species, much smaller than the female,

135.text: dare not approach his potential mate until she reaches sexual maturity.

139.text: Then, for a short period only, her fearsome mouthparts soften:

144.text: only then can the male copulate without fear of being eaten by his partner.
